definition: to appropriate to oneself (what rightfully belongs to others)
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: She possessed herself of the unclaimed goods.
sentences.chinese: 她把那些没人认领的货物占为己有。

sentences.english: He always takes credit for the work we've done together.
sentences.chinese: 他总是把我们共同工作的功劳占为己有。

sentences.english: Paul used fraudulent means of expropriating other people's money.
sentences.chinese: 保罗使用欺骗的办法将他人的钱财占为己有。

sentences.english: He always takes the credit for the work we've done together.
sentences.chinese: 他总是把我们共同工作的功劳占为己有。

sentences.english: Keeping it just did not seem right.
sentences.chinese: 占为己有似乎是不对的。

sentences.english: But the Phantom wanted Christine for himself.
sentences.chinese: 但是幽灵想把克里斯汀占为己有。

sentences.english: Plagiarism is the act of representing another person's words or ideas as your own.
sentences.chinese: 剽窃是一种把他人的言语或想法占为己有的做法。

sentences.english: Nicaragua occupied it last year on the basis of a Google map.
sentences.chinese: 去年尼加拉瓜在谷歌地图上将小岛占为己有。

sentences.english: He possessed himself of another's lands.
sentences.chinese: 他把别人的土地占为己有。

sentences.english: Originally, cares about a person really meeting to want to possess oneself of her.
sentences.chinese: 原来，在乎一个人真的会想把她占为己有。

sentences.english: Well once we invade and make it our own, you'll hear plenty about it, buster.
sentences.chinese: 等我们入侵并占为己有以后，你就会听得多了，老兄。

definition: to take for one's own/to expropriate
to hog/to keep everything for oneself
to keep hidden/to keep in one's private possession/secret store/stash
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
